title: Kill yourself.
body:
This is the worst thing you can possibly say to someone here because it is the _only_ thing that can lead to actual harm. It doesn't matter if you're the enemy Kayle telling me to do it because I'm beating you 5-0 with Garen, or you're my ally telling me to do it because I died to a counter jungle as Warwick. If I'm in the state of mind where I've actually been contemplating suicide-- and since you all don't know my name it's okay to tell you that I have been for quite some time-- the words have weight. 

Simply seeing those two words aimed at me crushes me a little more, cuts a little deeper despite the fact you don't know my name, I don't know yours, and I know you don't know how much I really want to. I've even taken to responding jokingly with the all-too**-true** statement,
"I was going to, but someone called the police." 

I don't think it needs to stop because this community is full of assholes-- the kind of game this is dictates that the community will always be full of assholes. I think it needs to stop because it has stronger implications than anything else you could say. Call me a bad player, fine. Call me a slur that doesn't actually apply to me because you don't know me, fine. But when you tell me to kill myself, you don't need to know me to hurt me.

Edit: I've noticed there are a few people coming out of the woodworks to say, "stop being a bitch." Since that solution relies on the premise that this is a matter of strength, it's incorrect in its base assumption and needs no further rebuttal. All I'll say is that I actually agree when it comes to offensive things. Merely _offending_ someone should never warrant a punishment, since offense it entirely subjective. But this isn't offense, it's objectively an attack on the person. The one condition is that you may be in ARAM and need to buy, but even then the time difference between typing "execute" and "kys" isn't an excuse.

Declovone, we've disagreed several times in the past, but for what it's worth, I'm glad you're still among the living. I don't know where the current trend of "kys" emerged from (I played WoW like it was my job from like 2005 to 2012 and never heard it), but people need to understand how fucked up it is to say that to somebody. In general, the concept of suicide and suicidal tendency is extremely misunderstood by wide swaths of the community, and more people need to read an account like yours in order to grasp what sort of impact these words can have.

There's no situation in which it is appropriate to say "kill yourself" or "kys" to anyone, ever. I understand flaming can help sometimes, I understand no one is perfect, but like I said before- saying "kill yourself" is never an appropriate action when faced with a tough matchup, or when you get tilted. It isn't just about people being sensitive, it's about the principle of what the phrase means, and it's honestly disgusting when people use the term so carefree.

That's not how depression and suicidal tendencies work. I generally don't downvote people simply because I disagree with them, but you're *dangerously* off base here. Please take some time to read up on what drives people to suicide, and how to properly communicate with people on the brink. It may help you save a life or ease the burden of a loved one some day.

The act of suicide may be cowardly, but the people who go on living while constantly bombarded with the compulsion to perform the act deserve our empathy. I sincerely hope your attitude towards individuals with depression matures before somebody you care about attempts to open up to you about their own struggles.

You know, it will be a HELL of a lot easier to say it here, but here it goes. A little over a week ago I attempted suicide using my father's pistol while I was alone. Long story short, for years my parents have had a lot of heated arguments between themselves and with me. It made me feel miserable, they forced me into doing what they wanted me to do, insulted me, wanted to divorce, etc. I felt like a bastard and was permanently stressed.

I was playing LoL, losing, people flaming each other, including me. Nobody told me to kill myself or "KYS". But I felt miserable, it all just added up on top of the rest. It was the final straw. I went and loaded the pistol. The ONLY reason I'm still alive is it misfired and I didn't have the courage to load another bullet.

In other words someone flaming me over a stupid game pushed me over the edge. Now imagine what telling someone to kill themselves in my situation does to them and let it sink in real well.

You can call me a coward, a crybaby, a snowflake or whatever, but until you fall in my situation or worse, you will never understand people like me, so DON'T EVEN BOTHER!
All I can say is I'm sincerely happy that your friend "jumped over the pit" and is still alive. And that he is very fortunate to have a friend like you.
For what it's worth, i'm glad you're still with us.

As for league, I recommend that at even the first hint of flaming or negativity you mute them. It is 100% there responsibility to not say awful things, but there’s too many people out there to hope that they’re all responsible. So just mute and ignore the flamers before they start saying really messed up things.
